title: Seated Tahitian Woman (recto), Sketches of Roosters and Chickens (verso)

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of black fabricated chalk, selectively blended, with touches of brush and gray gouache, over traces of black fabricated chalk offset (recto); graphite (verso); on ivory wove paper (removed from a sketchbook).

medium_display: Black fabricated chalk, selectively blended, with touches of brush and gray gouache, over traces of black fabricated chalk offset (recto); graphite (verso); on ivory wove paper (removed from a sketchbook)
publication_history:
Wildenstein & Co., A Loan Exhibition of Paul Gauguin, for the Benefit of the New York Infirmary, with an essay by Raymond Cogniat (Wildenstein & Co., 1946), p. 68, cat. 48.

Robert Goldwater and Carl O. Schniewind, Gauguin: Loan Exhibitionfor the Benefit of the Citizens’ Committee for Children of New York City, Inc., exh. cat. (Wildenstein & Co., 1956), p. 21, cat. 72.

Robert Goldwater, Paul Gauguin (Abrams, 1957), p. 26 (ill.).

Stephen Longstreet, The Drawings of Gauguin (Borden, 1965), n.pag. (ill.).

René Huyghe, Gauguin (Flammarion, 1967), p. 68 (ill.).

Alberto Martini, I maestri del colore: Gauguin (Fratelli Fabbri, 1963, 1977), n.pag., fig. 2. Translated as Ernst W. Glaub, Galerie der Grossen Maler: Gauguin (Bastei, 1968), n.pag., fig. 2.

Harold Joachim and Sandra Haller Olsen, French Drawings and Sketchbooks of the Nineteenth Century, vol. 2 (University of Chicago Press, 1979), p. 58 (ill.), no. 3E5.

Robert Goldwater, Paul Gauguin (Abrams, 1983), p. 24 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
New York, Wildenstein and Company, "Paul Gauguin," April 3-May 4, 1946, p. 68, cat. 48 (recto).

The Minneapolis Institute of Arts, "Gauguin in Tahiti," 1950 (recto).

New York, Wildenstein and Company, "Gauguin," April 5-May 5, 1956, p. 21, cat. 72 as Two crouched Tahitian Women (recto).
provenance_text: Sold by Galerie St. Etienne, New York, to the Art Institute, 1943.
section_titles: Cat. 35  Seated Tahitian Woman (recto), Sketches of Roosters and Chickens (verso), 1891/93
